title: Occupational Therapy Digital Learning Design: Integrated Flipped, Blended, and Gamification Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic occupational therapy theory and understanding of fundamental clinical skills
context.additional_context: Project-based performance to enhance occupational therapy practical competencies in a digital environment utilizing personal devices.

learning_goals: Learners self-directly acquire 80% or more of core occupational therapy theories (professional reasoning, procedural knowledge) via flipped learning.
Complete and submit a real clinical case analysis project using PBL methods in a blended learning environment.
Perform three or more occupational therapy simulation tasks utilizing gamification elements (quests, badges, leaderboards).
Write and incorporate peer evaluations and feedback five or more times using digital tools (apps, online platforms).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
